snippet: The plan to retrofit taxis to make them wheelchair accessible is expensive and inefficient. There’s a better way.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Matthew W Daus, former chairman of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, criticizes $54 million plan to retrofit city cabs to make them wheelchair-accessible; says expensive plan is inefficient because cabs will rarely be used by target demographic; recommends allocating smaller number of wheelchair-accessible cabs that disabled passengers could call upon through centralized dispatch system.
lead_paragraph: The plan to retrofit taxis to make them wheelchair accessible is expensive and inefficient. There’s a better way.

headline.seo: Improving Taxi Service for Wheelchair Users
